pages.text: Different $(item)Engines$() that can be used in a $(thing)Grappling Hook$().$(br)Engines have unique requirements and common stats:$(li)Launch Force: The initial speed of the launched hook.$(li)Winch Force: The acceleration and maximum force in Pulling Mode.$()
$(o)Good old manual labor$()$(br)Uses no external energy. Quite exhausting$(br)Launch Force: 2.0$(br)Winch Force: 2.4
$(o)Can anyone else hear the coil hum?$()$(br)Uses RF, recharges while rappeling$(br)Launch Force: 2.5$(br)Winch Force: 3.2
$(o)Victim of the Doppler Effect$()$(br)Uses RF. A clear upgrade over the simple one$(br)Launch Force: 5.0$(br)Winch Force: 4.4
$(o)pneumatic greatness$()$(br)The stats improve based on the internal and atmospherical pressure (aka y-Level)$(br)Base Launch Force: 2.5$(br)Base Winch Force: 3.8

The $(item)Mechanical Engine$() allows for free flight-like 3D movement in between deployed hooks and gravity. Best results are obtained with 3+ Hooks deployed rather far apart and above where you want to move. Outside the operational area defined by the hooks you will fall like a rock.
